item.title: Dynamic Linking Infographic
item.description: What happens when your code calls printf()? And what’s up with all that .got.plt stuff that you see when you decompile a binary? Here are some sketches I drew to help me remember this kind of stuff.

item.title: Writing Software For a Sounding Rocket
item.description: This year is going to be 5 years since I first joined Skyward Experimental Rocketry, and - oh boy, it has been a hell of a ride! We’ve just open-sourced the on-board software of our latest rocket, so I figured it would be cool to write a high-level introduction to the magical world of sounding rockets, from a software perspective.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! I’m Alvise, a (former) software engineer with an embedded systems background and (now) PhD student at the Vrije University of Amsterdam in the VUSec group. I like microarchitectural attacks, embedded & hardware security, program analysis, and anything at interface between hardware and software. I also like music, audiovisual arts, and sometimes humans too.

item.title: [Writeup] Some (Web) Assembly Required
item.description: I’ve been looking at some old picoCTF challenges lately, this is my solution for one of them. It’s a gentle introduction to decompilation and reversing, but with a spinkle of Web Assembly on top.
